snippet: Vladimir Markin, the spokesman for the federal Investigative Committee, said the attack appeared to be “a warning to other journalists” involved in news coverage about the government’s campaign against insurgents.
abstract: Gunmen kill news anchor Kazbek Gekkiyev in Nalchik, town in North Caucasus region of Russia; investigators believe Gekkiyev was likely killed in retaliation for his work reporting on Islamic insurgency active in region.
lead_paragraph: Vladimir Markin, the spokesman for the federal Investigative Committee, said the attack appeared to be “a warning to other journalists” involved in news coverage about the government’s campaign against insurgents.
